thread.title: Blue hunk Lee Ryan lands role in EastEnders as new Walford bad boy Woody
thread.title_full: Blue hunk Lee Ryan lands role in EastEnders as new Walford bad boy Woody

author: Nicola Agius
title: Blue hunk Lee Ryan lands role in EastEnders as new Walford bad boy Woody
text:
Blue hunk Lee Ryan lands role in EastEnders as new Walford bad boy Woody The singer-turned-actor can't wait to make his Albert Square debut Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get soaps updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Lee Ryan is joining the cast of EastEnders . 
BBC producers have signed the Blue hunk up to play Walford's new bad boy 'Woody' Woodward. 
After the news was announced, the singer-turned-actor admitted he is "so excited" to be joining the show. 
"Woody is the best role I could have wished to play," he said. "He’s a brilliant character, and it’s clear he’s been leading a full and colourful life. I can’t wait for people to see what he’s like for themselves. Lee Ryan is joining the cast of EastEnders (Photo: BBC) 
"Everyone at EastEnders has been so welcoming. I know some of the cast already so I’m sure we’re going to have a lot of fun." Read More 
EastEnders bosses are keeping tight-lipped over Woody for now and why he's decided to make Albert Square his new home. The star with his Blue bandmates Duncan James, Simon Webbe and Anthony Costa (Photo: Redferns) 
However, we're promised he's going to cause quite a stir when he arrives. 
Executive Producer Sean O’Connor said: "I’m delighted to welcome Lee Ryan to Walford as ‘Woody’ Woodward. Woody is a man who has worked hard and played hard in bars, clubs and pubs around the world and has finally decided to stop wandering and put down some roots. BBC producers have signed Lee up to play Walford's new bad boy 'Woody' Woodward (Photo: Getty) 
"He’s going to ruffle some feathers and obviously break some hearts, so there’s a great deal to look forward to as soon as he bursts onto the square. Lee is a perfect casting for Albert Square and we knew straight away we wanted him for the role." 
*EastEnders returns to BBC One on Thursday at 7.30pm Like us on Facebook
